name: gdx-ai
description: Artificial Intelligence framework featuring Steering Behaviors, Formation Motion, Pathfinding, Behavior Trees and Finite State Machines.

name: Simple Graphs
description: A java library for graph data structures and algorithms (including fast pathfinding).

name: Controllers
description: Adds support to gamepads and joysticks.

name: gdx-controllerutils
description: Adds Scene2D button input support, user configurable button mappings and hotplugging for LWJGL2.

name: sdl2gdx
description: Powerful gamepad implementation using SDL. Supports hundreds of controllers under the same mapping, rumble, and hotplugging.

name: HyperLap2D
description: Visual editor for complex 2D worlds and scenes with a runtime for libGDX.

name: Spine
description: Skeleton-based animation tool that focuses specifically on 2D animation for games.

name: Artemis-odb
description: High performance java based Entity-Component-System framework.

name: Ashley
description: A Java entity system inspired by Ash & Artemis.

name: Box2D
description: One of the most popular physics libraries for 2D games.

name: Bullet
description: 3D Collision Detection and Rigid Body Dynamics Library.

name: jbump
description: Easy to implement AABB collision detection useful for platformers and other simple 2D games.

name: gdx-facebook
description: Provides cross-platform support for Facebook Graph API.

name: gdx-fireapp
description: Cross-platform API for Firebase.

name: gdx-firebase
description: Cross-platform (only Desktop/Android) API for Firebase.

name: gdx-gameanalytics
description: Game Analytics REST API client implementation for libGDX. Works on all backends.

name: gdx-gamesvcs
description: Easy integration of gameservices, such as Google Play Games, Apple Game Center, and more.

name: gdx-pay
description: Provides a cross-platform API for InApp purchasing.

name: steamworks4j
description: A thin wrapper which allows Java applications to access the Steamworks C++ API.

name: gdx-liftoff
description: A modern setup tool for libGDX that uses the current Gradle 5.x series.

name: Packr
description: Packages your JAR, assets and a JVM for distribution on Windows, Linux and macOS.

name: Freetype
description: Generate BitmapFonts of your desired size on the fly from lightweight .ttf font files.

name: gdx-dialogs
description: Provides cross-platform support for native dialogs.

name: gdx-skins
description: Free Scene2D GUI skins.

name: InGameConsole
description: Allows a developer to add a console (similar to how it is featured in Source games) to their game.

name: msdf-gdx
description: Provides lightweight utilities to draw high-quality MSDF (multi-channel signed distance field) text on libGDX.

name: PieMenu
description: Radial menus for Scene2D that are highly flexible and easy to customize.

name: Ray3K Skins
description: Free Scene2D.UI skins with example code, custom drawables, and experimental features.

name: Skin Composer
description: Create skins for libGDX scene2d.ui with a graphical interface.

name: TenPatch
description: An alternative to libGDX's 9patch implementation that implements multiple stretch regions.

name: TypingLabel
description: A libGDX Label that appears as if it was being typed in real time.

name: VisUI
description: Allows to create nice looking UI in libGDX using scene2d.ui. Note this is not a UI editor.

name: Box2DLights
description: 2D lighting framework that uses Box2D for raycasting and OpenGL ES 2.0 for rendering.

name: gdx-vfx
description: Flexible post-processing shader visual effects based on libgdx-contribs-postprocessing.

name: libgdx-screenmanager
description: A screen manager for libGDX supporting various transition effects

name: Particle Park
description: A showcase of downloadable particle effects with live previews.

name: Shape Drawer
description: A performant alternative to ShapeRenderer that avoids Batch flushing.

name: gdx-gltf
description: GLTF 3D file format support (import/export), PBR shaders, and others advanced rendering.

name: libgdx-graph
description: Provides a GUI to design your rendering pipeline and shaders, and a library to easily incorporate them into your games. Guide here

name: gdx-dbgagent
description: Java Agent for debugging common issues, like objects not being disposed and constants such as Color.WHITE being modified.

name: gdx-jnigen
description: Small library that allows C/C++ code to be written inline with Java source code.

name: gdxGifRecorder
description: A utility class that records a GIF and saves it automatically.

name: KTX
description: Kotlin extensions and utilities for libGDX.

name: noise4j
description: Simple map generators based on various procedural content generation tutorials.

name: Texture Packer GUI
description: A simple way to pack and manage texture atlases for libGDX game framework.

name: Official libGDX Wiki
description: Official libGDX wiki that contains a huge amount of information.

name: Tann's Hello libGDX
description: An excellent guide for beginners on how to create a game from scratch.

name: Brandon Grasley's Space Shooter Game
description: Video tutorial series on making a complete Android game from scratch.

name: Splash Screens
description: Video tutorial on creating splash screens to display before your game window loads.

name: Creating a Launcher
description: Video tutorial on using libGDX to make a game launcher.

name: Deploying with JPackage
description: A tutorial on deploying libGDX games with JPackage via Gradle commands.

name: JSON in Game Dev
description: General tutorial on using JSON for storing data.

name: Progress Bar Design
description: Discusses the pros and cons of different progress bar design techniques with examples.

name: libGDX External Tutorials
description: Big list of official unofficial tutorials.

name: Code Hotswapping
description: Video tutorial on enabling code hotswapping for libGDX projects to increase productivity.

name: Dynamic Textures with Pixmap
description: Details how to create a mask using Pixmaps.

name: iOS Deployment Tutorial
description: Deploying to iOS in 2019 using RoboVM.

name: Sub-pixel Perfect Smooth Scrolling
description: Pixel-perfect smooth scrolling.

name: Kenney Assets
description: High quality assets for your game, from 2D and 3D art to sound effects.

name: OpenGameArt.org
description: Repository offering a variety of open content assets.

name: Game-Icons.net
description: Repository containing heaps of cool game related graphics.

name: bfxr.net
description: Quickly create unique sound effects by pressing a few buttons, excellent for prototyping.

name: freesound.org
description: Huge collaborative database of audio snippets, samples, recordings, bleeps.

name: Discord
description: An active chat with various leaders from the community available every day. Recommended

name: Reddit
description: Unofficial subreddit for libGDX. Not a lot of activity.

name: Game Networking
description: A Curated List of Game Network Programming Resources.

name: Game Talks
description: A curated list of gaming talks (development, design, etc).

name: Java
description: A curated list of awesome Java frameworks, libraries and software.

name: Kotlin
description: A curated list of awesome Kotlin related stuff.

name: Magic Tools
description: A list of Game Development resources to make magic happen.

name: Game Accessibility Guidelines
description: A straightforward reference for inclusive game design, to ensure that games are just as fun for as wide a range of people as possible. Recommended
